headline.main: PRESIDENT FLAYS HOSTAGE KILLINGS; Calls Nazi Acts Those of Men Who Know They Can't Win -- Churchill Seconds Him

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 -- President Roosevelt denounced in scathing terms today the German executions of "innocent hostages" in France. He declared that these killings were revolting and that it was impossible to break men's spirit by terrorism.
snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 25 -- President Roosevelt denounced in scathing terms today the German executions of "innocent hostages" in France. He declared that these killings were revolting and that it was impossible to break men's spirit by terrorism....

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
